title: Prometheus metric for validator_statuses gives wrong status after all keys exited
body:
### Describe the bug

Server was configured with 540 keys.
After all keys were unstaked, 3 of 540 stuck on validator status = 4 (**Exiting**). This situation continued for **2d 9h**.
Logs show that prysm validator node detects status properly at some point, at least.
But Prometheus metric is stuck. 
After validator process was restarted, metric changed to Exited.
![2023-12-18_16-38](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/assets/56387196/64845f40-0763-4851-a7d4-01ae8a84a3cf)
![2023-12-18_16-41](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/assets/56387196/3e20fbdd-96b8-46bb-bceb-310768607b18)

### Platform(s)

Linux (x86)

### What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)

v4.1.1

### Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?

https://beaconcha.in/validator/8f5ed3513e008a4d5d2c9ca580bf01329cd0f4f353ca8614f6743d1db624420c3fb6212e73b2611bc93f4e31d5f3d7dc

Seems like an issue where there are no more active validators, so the metrics are never updated again. 

```go
        // validator/client/validator.go @ line 591, UpdateDuties
        // When all validators are exited, the following condition evaluates to true.
	if allExitedCounter != 0 && allExitedCounter == len(resp.CurrentEpochDuties) {
		return ErrValidatorsAllExited // Then the routine exits here.
	}

	v.dutiesLock.Lock()
	v.duties = resp
	v.logDuties(slot, v.duties.CurrentEpochDuties, v.duties.NextEpochDuties) // However, this method updates the metrics
	v.dutiesLock.Unlock()
```

Seems like we would need to call logDuties before exiting `UpdateDuties` to satisfy this issue. 

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/374d77f43716846708d7e090de68414f9442052d/validator/client/validator.go#L591-L598
Is anyone fixing this? If not, I'd like to do.
